intro: Rupicapnos gaetula, commonly known as the Gaetulan rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapting to arid environments. Rupicapnos gaetula is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
